text: oh and this is yo Cunningham from 5th
Avenue and the illusion that the streets
of Manhattan
are paved with gold almost came to a
reality as they were gilding the crown
building on the corner of Fifth Avenue
and 57th Street and the gold work and
little flecks of the gold leaf would
flutter down onto the sidewalk as a
matter of fact one year the golden leaf
flooded down and landed on the top of my
camera because I used to photograph on
that corner and the interesting part as
flecks of gold leaf floated down to the
sidewalk was to see pedestrians passing
by in gold clothes or gold bags
accessories just a flecks of gold in an
overall print from Dior the lady I see
pass every morning always in big scarves
and beads bright brilliant gold beads on
black and another morning in front of
the Louis Vuitton windows that are
opposite the crown building and they had
all summer gold palm leaves and trom
trees arching the windows dresses were
gold flecks or gold embroidery and there
was even a young woman on the Long
Island Rail Road on her way to the
Hamptons and the kids are sitting there
and they've got their legs up in the air
touching the baggage rack with their
gold sandals it's just life in New York
as it is today don't believe that the
streets are paved with gold they're not
but there is the thought of it as I say
the gold leaf that's applied to
the ornamentation of some buildings that
it flutters down it just a lovely
midsummer fantasy
Oh
